text: Hey, what's up creators and welcome back
to the first hour of Unreal Engine
course. In this video, we're going to be
continuing to create our coins. So,
we've got a blueprint class already and
a rough coin shape. What we're going to
be doing in this video is a couple of
things. First things first, we're going
to be giving it a gold material so that
way our coin, well, looks like a coin.
We're also going to be adding a rotating
movement component so that it spins and
yep, well, very obviously looks like a
coin. And then lastly, we're going to be
adding collision to this. So when we
start building the logic for being able
to actually pick this up, we have
something for the player to collide
with. It's going to be a really exciting
video. And let's jump straight into
Unreal. Going into our blueprint now, a
couple more things we're going to do
with this. The first one is with our
cylinder. We're going to go down to our
materials and we're going to make this
gold. The way that we're going to do
this is by creating a material.
We can do that by just going to our
content drawer. And then I'm just going
to right click in here and create a
material and give it the name M Gold. M
being the naming convention for
material. Then I'm going to open it up.
Now I'm going to fast track you through
the creation of this as creating
materials is a whole topic that you've
got to look forward to that is going to,
you know, come up later on in your
Unreal Engine Learning journey. But the
main ones we're going to take a look at
is our base color. So over in our base
color, we can click on the preview here,
which is currently gray. And we can set
it to an orangey yellow color, and press
okay, which is going to make it yellow.
And then our roughness, I'm going to set
this down to zero to make it shiny. And
my metallic, I'm going to set this to
one, which is going to make it look like
metal. And as you can see, now my
material is now gold. So, just to recap,
the base color is going to change the
color of the object. The metallic is
going to change how metal this should
look. And the roughness is going to
change how shiny this should be. And
I've just changed these numbers. And I
want you to do the same thing. Go ahead
and press apply. And then minimize this.
Go back to your content drawer. Open up
your collectible. Now with our coin
selected, we can go into the details
materials and set this to our m gold
that we created. And now we have a very
simple gold coin. Go ahead and hit
compile on this. Hit play. And you
should be able to see now that you have
a gold coin in our space. Just for good
measure, what I also want to do now is
to show you how we can make our coin
just rotate on the spot. really simple
effect um and something that you're
probably going to use quite often. The
way I'm going to do this is I'm going to
open up that blueprint again, go to
components, and then what I'm going to
do is just add a rotating movement
component. What this is going to do is
simply just tell it to move around on a
particular axis. In this case, the it's
180° on the Z. And if I press play, you
can see the coin is now spinning. Okay,
at this point, we now have our coin set
up. It's gold, it's spinning, and it's
the correct size. What we're going to
move on to now is showing you how we can
set up the collision for this to make
sure that once we come to doing our
programming later on, our player can
detect this and run code when it
interacts with it. Let's jump back into
Unreal Engine. We're going to go back to
our content drawer and open up the
collectible.
And inside of here, we're going to need
a component called a sphere collision.
This is just going to give us some space
where we have a collision that of course
we can tie code to later on. Go to
components, add, and then all I want you
to do is search for sphere collision.
And then go ahead and add this. Make
sure that it covers all of your coin. If
it doesn't, just use that scale tool to
adjust it to make sure it goes over all
of it.
Then with that done, compile,
minimize, and we're good to go. Okay,
that's it. Our coin is starting to take
shape. We have got a blueprint. We have
got the visuals, and we've got
collision, and it's all ready for us to
start implementing the blueprint logic
for us to be able to collect this. And
that's all stuff that we're going to be
doing in the next few videos. Move on to

Engine learning journey. But as always,
